question: The Indian National Congress agreed in 1947 to the partition of the country mainly because?
option1: the principle of two-Nation theory was then acceptable to them
option2: it was imposed by the British Government and the Congress was helpless in this regard
option3: they wanted to avoid large-scale communal riots
option4: India would have otherwise lost the opportunity to attain freedom
answer: they wanted to avoid large-scale communal riots
explanation:
The Indian National Congress agreed in 1947 to the partition of the country mainly because they wanted to avoid communal violence. Jinnah called upon the Muslims to join:
\"karke Lenge Pakistan, Ladke Lenge Pakistan\"
